name: Dudhsagar Waterfalls
description: One of India's tallest waterfalls, Dudhsagar creates a spectacular milky cascade. Best visited during monsoon season.

startingPoint.name: Collem Railway Station
startingPoint.description: Main entry point for Dudhsagar with jeep safari services

camping.reason: Protected forest area, camping not permitted

permits.bookingRequired: Advance booking recommended during peak season

monsoon.conditions: Waterfall at full flow, heavy rainfall, muddy paths
monsoon.recommendation: Best time to visit for waterfall experience

winter.conditions: Reduced water flow, pleasant weather, clear skies
winter.recommendation: Good for photography and easy access

summer.conditions: Minimal water flow, hot and humid
summer.recommendation: Not recommended, waterfall may be dry

waypoints.name: Jeep Drop Point
waypoints.description: End of jeep safari, start of walking trail

steps: Take train from Mumbai CST to Dudhsagar Station
Get down at Dudhsagar Railway Station
Short walk to waterfall viewpoint

steps: Take bus from Mumbai to Collem
Book jeep safari from Collem
Jeep ride through forest to falls

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive to Collem, then jeep required
steps: Drive to Collem village
Park vehicle at designated area
Take jeep safari to waterfall

byTrain.description: Train via Mumbai to Dudhsagar Station
steps: Take train from Pune to Mumbai CST
Change to train going to Dudhsagar Station
Short walk to waterfall viewpoint

byBus.description: Bus via Mumbai to Collem, then jeep safari
steps: Take bus from Pune to Mumbai
Change to bus going to Collem
Book jeep safari from Collem
Take Pune-Mumbai-Goa Highway
Drive to Collem village
Take jeep safari to waterfall

name: Lohagad Fort
description: Historic 'Iron Fort' near Lonavala, known for its iconic four gates, Vinchu Kata spur, and lush monsoon views.

startingPoint.name: Lohagad Wadi (Base village)
startingPoint.description: Small village and trek base accessible from Malavli station or Lonavala.

recommendations: Carry food; water may be scarce

camping.reason: Protected fort; no overnight camping permitted

nearbyStays.name: Lonavala Resorts / Hotels
facilities: Multiple options from budget to luxury

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, lush greenery, slippery trail
monsoon.recommendation: Great scenic views but use caution

name: Tikona Fort
description: Triangular-shaped fort near Kamshet, perfect for beginners. Famous for its unique shape and panoramic views of Pawna Lake.

startingPoint.description: Small village at the base with basic facilities and friendly locals

winter.conditions: Pleasant weather, clear views of Pawna Lake

name: Visapur Fort
description: Twin fort of Lohagad, famous for its massive structure and monsoon waterfalls. Known for the spectacular waterfall stairs during monsoon.

name: Rajmachi Fort
description: Rajmachi comprises two hill forts—Shrivardhan (~3000 ft) and Manaranjan (~2700 ft)—famous for lush forest trails, fireflies, camping, sunrise views, Kataldhar waterfall and twin fort ruins.

startingPoint.name: Udhewadi Village
startingPoint.description: Udhewadi (Rajmachi village) lies 16 km from Lonavala by forest road or 10 km by Karjat route; it's the base for both forts.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108/112; signal only near village or summit

waterSources: None mid-trail; streams at dry season unreliable
foodOptions: Pack snacks; no stalls en route
recommendations: Carry 3–4 L water, energy snacks, dry fruits

camping.cost: ₹600–700 per person for food + ₹600 per tent

permits.entry: ₹5 per person + vehicle tax (₹100/4‑wheeler; ₹20/2‑wheeler) collected by locals
permits.timings: Trek is open year‑round; camping allowed; night trekking popular but riskier

monsoon.conditions: Lush trails, fireflies, slippery rock sections
monsoon.recommendation: Ideal for campers; caution advised on trail

winter.conditions: Clear skies, cool weather, perfect for trekking

trekRoute.totalDistance: 16 km via Lonavala; 10 km via Karjat route
trekRoute.ascent: 350 m to Udhewadi + ~300 m to Shrivardhan
trekRoute.difficulty: Easy to Moderate; forest roads and paved sections, mild rocky climb

waypoints.name: Shrivardhan Fort
waypoints.description: Main fort with water tanks and view

byTrain.description: Mumbai to Lonavala (local/express); then auto/jeep to Tungarli dam/Udhewadi
steps: Local train to Lonavala
Auto to Tungarli dam/Udhewadi
Trek to Udhewadi
Continue to fort

byBus.description: MSRTC to Lonavala, then local transport as above

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai–Pune Expressway, park at Lonavala or near village (off-road required)
byPrivateVehicle.warning: 16 km off-road; high‑clearance vehicle needed monsoon

byTrain.description: Pune → Lonavala train, then same local transport

byBus.description: MSRTC to Lonavala + local transport

bestTimeToVisit: October to February (winter); monsoon for fireflies experience

description: Ancient Buddhist caves dating from 2nd century BC, featuring beautiful stupas and intricate rock carvings. A UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Peb Fort (Vikatgad)
description: Peb Fort, also known as Vikatgad, is a scenic hill fort near Matheran. The trail passes through lush forest, rocky patches, and features a thrilling ladder climb near the top. It offers views of Neral, Matheran hill station, and nearby Sahyadri ranges.

startingPoint.name: Neral (Anandwadi)
startingPoint.description: Neral is well connected via local trains from Mumbai and Pune. Anandwadi is a 15–20 min walk from Neral station and serves as the entry point to the trail.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Pre-trek notification advised. Dial 108/112 in case of network availability. No dedicated medical/rescue post on trek.

foodAccommodation.foodOnTrek: No food stalls mid-trek. Tea and snacks available in Neral only. Carry packed meals.
foodAccommodation.waterSources: Small streams during monsoon; unreliable during dry season. Carry 2L minimum.
foodAccommodation.campingOptions: Allowed near Anandwadi fields or summit cave with sleeping bags. No official campsites.

trail: Start from Anandwadi village near Neral.
Walk along toy train track from marker 134 NM → 155 NM.
Turn into forest trail after marker 155.
Rocky climb with exposed ridge walk.
Reach iron ladder and climb to summit plateau.
Explore caves, Datta temple, and flagpole.
alternativeRoutes: From Matheran via Sunset Point ridge (longer)
seasonalNotes: Monsoon: lush & slippery, Summer: dry but hot, Winter: best for clear views

permitInfo.howToApply: No permit needed for individuals or groups.
permitInfo.timingRestrictions: Avoid after sunset. Local police may stop overnight campers during monsoon.

name: Bhivpuri Waterfalls
